articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Second case of coronavirus confirmed in the U.S.
articles.description: The battle against a new and deadly virus is kicking into high gear after a second case of coronavirus in the U.S. was confirmed in Chicago. Dean Reynolds reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: China officials scramble to build hospital as virus spreads
articles.description: Officials in Wuhan, China, are sccrambling to build a new hospital by the end of next week, to treat the flood of patients. It comes amid the spread of coronavirus, which has killed more than 40 people. Ramy Inocencio reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Second case of coronavirus confirmed in U.S.
articles.description: Health officials in Illinois have confirmed a second U.S. patient has tested positive for the deadly coronavirus. The virus originated in China, where more than 30 million people in 13 Chinese cities are under lockdown. CBS News foreign correspondent Ramy Ino…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Stocks fall as coronavirus cases appear in U.S.
articles.description: Wall Street saw its worst day in months, with shares of health care and travel companies taking big hits.
articles.content:
Health-care companies led a broad slide in U.S. stocks Friday afternoon as increased fears over the spread of a deadly outbreak of coronavirus rattled markets.
The S&P 500-stock index had its worst day since early October, ending down nearly 1% to 3295. … [+2252 chars]

articles.author: Kate Gibson
articles.title: Coronavirus fears close Shanghai Disney Resort
articles.description: Theme-park operator's decision in China comes as health officials in U.S. confirm another case of the deadly virus.
articles.content:
Walt Disney's Shanghai Disney Resort in China is closing until further notice in the face of the rapidly spreading coronavirus. 
The decision to close comes during the seven-day Lunar New Year holiday, a time when hundreds of millions of Chinese travel at ho… [+2263 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: What is the coronavirus illness blamed for multiple deaths in China?
articles.description: Officials in China and around the world are racing to contain the spread of a deadly new strain of virus.
articles.content: Officials in China are racing to contain a deadly new strain of virus that has infected more than 800 people and left more than two dozen dead. Chinese officials have blocked all transportation in and out of the city of Wuhan, where the outbreak of the "2019 … [+6080 chars]

articles.title: Eye Opener at 8: More coronavirus cases in U.S.
articles.description: A look back at what we've been covering on "CBS This Morning."

articles.title: WORLD NEWS ROUNDUP: 01/24
articles.description: More coronavirus deaths in China, and potential cases in the United States. Democrats push for impeachment, while President Trump's lawyers wait on deck. Jail -- for the highest-ranking "Big Pharma" boss busted in the opioid crisis. Correspondent Steve Kathan…

articles.title: Coronavirus spreads to 12 possible cases in U.S.
articles.description: Ten Chinese cities with a combined population of around 33 million people are now off limits as the coronavirus infects over 800 people around the world. In the U.S., 10 possible cases in California, one in Texas and one in Tennessee are in isolation awaiting…

articles.title: Eye Opener: Democrats prepare for final day of impeachment arguments
articles.description: House Democrats will make an all-out push for President Trump's impeachment in their final day of opening arguments in the Senate trial. Also, the coronavirus could be spreading even further in the United States. Several states have reported possible cases. A…

articles.title: China locks down more cities in unprecedented bid to contain virus
articles.description: The deadly coronavirus has now sickened more than 800 people.
articles.content: The World Health Organization (WHO) was holding emergency talks Thursday in Geneva to decide whether the deadly virus outbreak constitutes a "public health emergency of international concern." The designation is rare and only used for the gravest outbreaks wh… [+1384 chars]
